To do input validation.  Let me explain=
: I'm currently pondering how
to best deal with resources that are pure beh=
aviors (i.e. only accept
POST) in Dream, our REST framework.  If I associat=
e a RelaxNG schema
with the resource, I can use it to validate input before=
 it reaches
the implementation; and I _could_ use it to generate a form.  T=
he form
would be returned on a GET request, making the resource reflective =
(or
self-descriptive).  Now, developers could use the form to interact
with=
 the resource directly, which has a lot pedagogical value.

However, if I t=
ake the opposite approach, meaning that if a GET were
to return a form, I w=
ould not get the automatic input validation
benefit unless I were able to g=
enerate the schema from the form.

Thus, my current inclination is to use a=
 RelaxNG schema to both do
input validation and interact with the resource.=
